attachments.title: Designing and Implementing Glimmer Like a Programming Language
attachments.text: The first Ember view layer was designed kind of like you'd expect: it treated the "template language" as a very specialized external DSL with a decent amount of special syntax. In addition, the implementation was very ad-hoc, which led to a number of persistent, whack-a-mole bugs (including cases where "string
attachments.fallback: The Feedback Loop: Designing and Implementing Glimmer Like a Programming Language

text: > A recent commit to our job queue ("backburner") allows it to handle "smeared" tasks that can run across multiple turns.
Whoa, when did backburner get rewritten in typescript? I need to pay more attention
